text.content:
Discharge note: Pt admitted for Bilateral Lower Lobe Pneumonia.  Responded well 
to IV antibiotics.
 
Date of Admission: 11/18/2011
 
Date of Discharge: 11/20/2011
 
Diagnoses Treated: Pneumonia
 
Discharge Diet:
The patient's discharge diet is Regular.
 
 
========================= OUTPATIENT MEDICATION LIST =====================

     OUTPT MEDICATIONS: 
     ------------------

           DRUG                                    STATUS 
           ----                                    ------ 
ASPIRIN 81MG EC TAB                                ACTIVE 
   SIG: TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY DAY
CALCIUM CARBONATE 1.25GM (CA 500MG) TAB            ACTIVE 
   SIG: TAKE 500 MG BY MOUTH THREE TIMES A DAY
CHLORTHALIDONE 25MG TAB                            ACTIVE 
   SIG: TAKE 12.5 MG  BY MOUTH DAILY
ERGOCALCIFEROL 1000 UNIT CAP                       ACTIVE 
   SIG: TAKE 1000 UNITS BY MOUTH DAILY
GLYBURIDE 2.5MG TAB                                ACTIVE 
   SIG: TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY DAY
LEVOTHYROXINE NA (SYNTHROID) 0.125MG TAB           ACTIVE 
   SIG: TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH DAILY
LISINOPRIL 20MG TAB                                ACTIVE 
   SIG: TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH DAILY
SIMVASTATIN 80MG TAB                               ACTIVE 
   SIG: TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY EVENING
VENLAFAXINE HCL 37.5MG TAB                         ACTIVE 
   SIG: TAKE TWO TABLETS BY MOUTH TWICE A DAY


==========================================================================
  Pharmacy has been alerted to provide the patient with discharge
  medication instructions.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------


     For the benefit of the Patient, Pharmacist and the PCP, 
     please complete the following: 

                      -------------------------- 
                      MEDICATION RECONCILIATION: 
                      --------------------------
  I have reviewed the inpatient and outpatient meds, and
  changes (and reason for the changes) that have been made, or will be
  made to the outpatient medications are:
    Addition of oral Antibiotics.  No other changes.
 
  Patient indicated influenza was received previously.
    Date: in the fall

 
PHYSICAL ACTIVITY LIMITATIONS
There are no restrictions.
 
DISPOSITION INSTRUCTIONS:
  Discharge patient to home, or to a family member's home.
    After discharge, this patient is safe to wait unattended in the
    admissions waiting area until transportation arrives, subject to
    concurrence by nursing.
 
Text discharge order entered.
 
Clinic follow up appointments:Primary Care Provider (PCP) in 2-4 weeks. 

  Other follow-up appointment(s) to schedule: n/a

 
  **Clerks: Please complete the appointment times for the requested
  appointments above.


WANDERING RISK ASSESSMENT (VA Directive 2010-052)
     Patient is NOT cognitively impaired.
 
 
PATIENT INSTRUCTIONS:  Patient was instructed to return to the ER if
  Shortness of breath, chest pain.
text.author: PROVIDER,TWENTYNINE
